instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Touch Bar Don't Work!
threads.message:
I have question:
The schematics shows on PP1V8 0SW DFR was supposed to get 1.8V, however, I'm getting 3.2V
I thought the problem was the touch, but i replaced and the problem still.

Any thoughts on that?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Touch Bar Don't Work!
threads.message: It comes from <CHIP>U4404</CHIP>, which is probably shorted IN-OUT...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Touch Bar Don't Work!
threads.message: double check that its actually 3.2V and confirm pin  3 and 4 of <CHIP>U4404</CHIP>, if you have power going in and the enable signal , that will help you narrow down the issue to that section of the circuit
